alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:30PM EDT until June 24 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL SUWANNEE AND SOUTH CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 329 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Live Oak, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Suwannee Springs, Wellborn, Mcalpin and Houston. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
